definition: to take unfair advantage of/to deceive/to cheat
to cheat/to swindle/to pretend/to feign/to draw sb out/to try to extract information by deceit or bluff

sentences.english: Trade on the net, most those who make a person afraid is con.

sentences.english: "This is fraudulent accounting, " said Melanie Coath, climate change officer at RSPB.

sentences.english: Favour is deceitful, and beauty is vain.

sentences.english: She served a year in jail for her role in a fraudulent Enron tax return.
